title: JSON schema for the TSLint configuration files.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-function-over-method.description: Warns for class methods that do not use 'this'.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___number-literal-format.description: Checks that decimal literals should begin with '0.' instead of just '.', and should not end with a trailing '0'.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-consecutive-blank-lines.description: Disallows one or more blank lines in a row.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___switch-final-break.description: Checks whether the final clause of a switch statement ends in `break;`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___max-file-line-count.description: Requires files to remain under a certain number of lines

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___comment-format.description: Enforces formatting rules for single-line comments.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-conditional-expression.description: Recommends to use a conditional expression instead of assigning to the same thing in each branch of an if statement.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___quotemark.description: Requires single or double quotes for string literals.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___newline-per-chained-call.description: Requires that chained method calls be broken apart onto separate lines.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-unsafe-finally.description: Disallows control flow statements, such as `return`, `continue` `break` and `throws` in finally blocks.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___object-literal-key-quotes.description: Enforces consistent object literal property quote style.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___deprecation.description: Warns when deprecated APIs are used.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___indent.description: Enforces indentation with tabs or spaces.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___class-name.description: Enforces PascalCased class and interface names.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-duplicate-switch-case.description: Prevents duplicate cases in switch statements.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-implicit-dependencies.description: Disallows importing modules that are not listed as dependency in the project’s package.json.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___trailing-comma.description: Requires or disallows trailing commas in array and object literals, destructuring assignments, function typings, named imports and exports and function parameters.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-string-literal.description:
Forbids unnecessary string literal property access.
Allows `obj["prop-erty"]` (can't be a regular property access).
Disallows `obj["property"]` (should be `obj.property`).

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unnecessary-class.description: Disallows classes that are not strictly necessary.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-null-keyword.description: Disallows use of the `null` keyword literal.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-construct.description: Disallows access to the constructors of `String`, `Number`, and `Boolean`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___space-before-function-paren.description: Require or disallow a space before function parenthesis

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___use-isnan.description: Enforces use of the `isNaN()` function to check for NaN references instead of a comparison to the `NaN` constant.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___arrow-parens.description: Requires parentheses around the parameters of arrow function definitions.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-duplicate-super.description: Warns if 'super()' appears twice in a constructor.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___max-line-length.description: Requires lines to be under a certain max length.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-unnecessary-initializer.description: Forbids a 'var'/'let' statement or destructuring initializer to be initialized to 'undefined'.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___one-line.description: Requires the specified tokens to be on the same line as the expression preceding them.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___forin.description: Requires a `for ... in` statement to be filtered with an `if` statement.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___file-header.description: Enforces a certain header comment for all files, matched by a regular expression.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___prefer-method-signature.description: Prefer `foo(): void` over `foo: () => void` in interfaces and types.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___semicolon.description: Enforces consistent semicolon usage at the end of every statement.

Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___radix.description: Requires the radix parameter to be specified when calling `parseInt`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-for-in-array.description: Disallows iterating over an array with a for-in loop.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___cyclomatic-complexity.description: Enforces a threshold of cyclomatic complexity.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___one-variable-per-declaration.description: Disallows multiple variable definitions in the same declaration statement.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___prefer-for-of.description: Recommends a 'for-of' loop over a standard 'for' loop if the index is only used to access the array being iterated.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-unnecessary-callback-wrapper.description:
Replaces `x => f(x)` with just `f`.
To catch more cases, enable `only-arrow-functions` and `arrow-return-shorthand` too.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-void-expression.description: Requires expressions of type `void` to appear in statement position.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-template.description: Prefer a template expression over string literal concatenation.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-trailing-whitespace.description: Disallows trailing whitespace at the end of a line.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___newline-before-return.description: Enforces blank line before return when not the only line in the block.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___binary-expression-operand-order.description:
In a binary expression, a literal should always be on the right-hand side if possible.
For example, prefer 'x + 1' over '1 + x'.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-const.description: Requires that variable declarations use `const` instead of `let` and `var` if possible.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-invalid-this.description: Disallows using the `this` keyword outside of classes.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___switch-default.description: Require a `default` case in all `switch` statements.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-reference.description: Disallows `/// <reference path=>` imports (use ES6-style imports instead).

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-magic-numbers.description:
Disallows the use constant number values outside of variable assignments.
When no list of allowed values is specified, -1, 0 and 1 are allowed by default.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___typeof-compare.description: Makes sure result of `typeof` is compared to correct string values

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___restrict-plus-operands.description: When adding two variables, operands must both be of type number or of type string.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___object-literal-shorthand.description: Enforces use of ES6 object literal shorthand when possible.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-duplicate-imports.description: Disallows multiple import statements from the same module.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___space-within-parens.description: Enforces spaces within parentheses or disallow them.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___ban.description: Bans the use of specific functions or global methods.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___arrow-return-shorthand.description: Suggests to convert `() => { return x; }` to `() => x`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___completed-docs.description: Enforces documentation for important items be filled out.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-default-export.description: Disallows default exports in ES6-style modules.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___label-position.description: Only allows labels in sensible locations.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___promise-function-async.description: Requires any function or method that returns a promise to be marked async.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-use-before-declare.description: Disallows usage of variables before their declaration.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___max-classes-per-file.description: A file may not contain more than the specified number of classes

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___return-undefined.description: Prefer `return;` in void functions and `return undefined;` in value-returning functions.

Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___prefer-object-spread.description: Enforces the use of the ES2015 object spread operator over `Object.assign()` where appropriate.

Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___ordered-imports.description: Requires that import statements be alphabetized.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-sparse-arrays.description: Forbids array literals to contain missing elements.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___import-spacing.description: Ensures proper spacing between import statement keywords

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___variable-name.description: Checks variable names for various errors.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___eofline.description: Ensures the file ends with a newline.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___triple-equals.description: Requires `===` and `!==` in place of `==` and `!=`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___jsdoc-format.description: Enforces basic format rules for JSDoc comments.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___object-literal-sort-keys.description: Checks ordering of keys in object literals.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-duplicate-variable.description: Disallows duplicate variable declarations in the same block scope.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-irregular-whitespace.description: Disallow irregular whitespace outside of strings and comments

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-string-throw.description: Flags throwing plain strings or concatenations of strings because only Errors produce proper stack traces.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___import-blacklist.description:
Disallows importing the specified modules directly via `import` and `require`.
Instead only sub modules may be imported from that module.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-invalid-template-strings.description: Warns on use of `${` in non-template strings.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___new-parens.description: Requires parentheses when invoking a constructor via the `new` keyword.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-switch.description: Prefer a `switch` statement to an `if` statement with simple `===` comparisons.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-dynamic-delete.description: Bans usage of the delete operator with computed key expressions.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-console.description: Bans the use of specified `console` methods.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-conditional-assignment.description: Disallows any type of assignment in conditionals.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-unsafe-any.description:
Warns when using an expression of type 'any' in a dynamic way.
Uses are only allowed if they would work for `{} | null | undefined`.
Type casts and tests are allowed.
Expressions that work on all values (such as `"" + x`) are allowed.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___await-promise.description: Warns for an awaited value that is not a Promise.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unused-variable.description: Disallows unused imports, variables, functions and private class members. Similar to tsc's --noUnusedParameters and --noUnusedLocals options, but does not interrupt code compilation.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___member-access.description: Requires explicit visibility declarations for class members.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___array-type.description: Requires using either 'T[]' or 'Array<T>' for arrays.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-boolean-literal-compare.description: Warns on comparison to a boolean literal, as in `x === true`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-redundant-jsdoc.description: Forbids JSDoc which duplicates TypeScript functionality.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___callable-types.description: An interface or literal type with just a call signature can be written as a function type.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___match-default-export-name.description:
Requires that a default import have the same name as the declaration it imports.
Does nothing for anonymous default exports.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___adjacent-overload-signatures.description: Enforces function overloads to be consecutive.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-any.description: Disallows usages of `any` as a type declaration.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___type-literal-delimiter.description:
Checks that type literal members are separated by semicolons.
Enforces a trailing semicolon for multiline type literals.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-readonly.description: Requires that private variables are marked as `readonly` if they’re never modified outside of the constructor.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___strict-type-predicates.description:
Warns for type predicates that are always true or always false.
Works for 'typeof' comparisons to constants (e.g. 'typeof foo === "string"'), and equality comparison to 'null'/'undefined'.
(TypeScript won't let you compare '1 === 2', but it has an exception for '1 === undefined'.)
Does not yet work for 'instanceof'.
Does *not* warn for 'if (x.y)' where 'x.y' is always truthy. For that, see strict-boolean-expressions.

This rule requires `strictNullChecks` to work properly.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-mergeable-namespace.description: Disallows mergeable namespaces in the same file.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___typedef-whitespace.description: Requires or disallows whitespace for type definitions.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-var-requires.description: Disallows the use of require statements except in import statements.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___interface-over-type-literal.description: Prefer an interface declaration over a type literal (`type T = { ... }`)

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___strict-boolean-expressions.description:
Restricts the types allowed in boolean expressions. By default only booleans are allowed.

The following nodes are checked:
* Arguments to the `!`, `&&`, and `||` operators
* The condition in a conditional expression (`cond ? x : y`)
* Conditions for `if`, `for`, `while`, and `do-while` statements.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___use-default-type-parameter.description: Warns if an explicitly specified type argument is the default for that type parameter.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-misused-new.description: Warns on apparent attempts to define constructors for interfaces or `new` for classes.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-floating-promises.description: Promises returned by functions must be handled appropriately.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unbound-method.description: Warns when a method is used as outside of a method call.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-object-literal-type-assertion.description:
Forbids an object literal to appear in a type assertion expression.
Casting to `any` is still allowed.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-inferred-empty-object-type.description: Disallow type inference of {} (empty object type) at function and constructor call sites

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-unnecessary-type-assertion.description: Warns if a type assertion does not change the type of an expression.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___interface-name.description: Requires interface names to begin with a capital 'I'

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.
Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-reference-import.description: Don't `<reference types="foo" />` if you import `foo` anyway.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-inferrable-types.description: Disallows explicit type declarations for variables or parameters initialized to a number, string, or boolean.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-angle-bracket-type-assertion.description: Requires the use of `as Type` for type assertions instead of `<Type>`.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___unified-signatures.description: Warns for any two overloads that could be unified into one by using a union or an optional/rest parameter.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-unnecessary-qualifier.description: Warns when a namespace qualifier (`A.x`) is unnecessary.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___no-parameter-properties.description: Disallows parameter properties in class constructors.

___severity.description: Severity level. Level "error" will cause exit code 2.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___ban-types.description: Bans specific types from being used. Does not ban the corresponding runtime objects from being used.

___no-unsafe-any.description:
Warns when using an expression of type 'any' in a dynamic way.
Uses are only allowed if they would work for `{} | null | undefined`.
Type casts and tests are allowed.
Expressions that work on all values (such as `"" + x`) are allowed.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___await-promise.description: Warns for an awaited value that is not a Promise.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unused-variable.description: Disallows unused imports, variables, functions and private class members. Similar to tsc's --noUnusedParameters and --noUnusedLocals options, but does not interrupt code compilation.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___member-access.description: Requires explicit visibility declarations for class members.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___array-type.description: Requires using either 'T[]' or 'Array<T>' for arrays.

___no-boolean-literal-compare.description: Warns on comparison to a boolean literal, as in `x === true`.

___no-redundant-jsdoc.description: Forbids JSDoc which duplicates TypeScript functionality.

___callable-types.description: An interface or literal type with just a call signature can be written as a function type.

___match-default-export-name.description:
Requires that a default import have the same name as the declaration it imports.
Does nothing for anonymous default exports.

___adjacent-overload-signatures.description: Enforces function overloads to be consecutive.

___no-any.description: Disallows usages of `any` as a type declaration.

___type-literal-delimiter.description:
Checks that type literal members are separated by semicolons.
Enforces a trailing semicolon for multiline type literals.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-readonly.description: Requires that private variables are marked as `readonly` if they’re never modified outside of the constructor.

___strict-type-predicates.description:
Warns for type predicates that are always true or always false.
Works for 'typeof' comparisons to constants (e.g. 'typeof foo === "string"'), and equality comparison to 'null'/'undefined'.
(TypeScript won't let you compare '1 === 2', but it has an exception for '1 === undefined'.)
Does not yet work for 'instanceof'.
Does *not* warn for 'if (x.y)' where 'x.y' is always truthy. For that, see strict-boolean-expressions.

This rule requires `strictNullChecks` to work properly.

___no-mergeable-namespace.description: Disallows mergeable namespaces in the same file.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___typedef-whitespace.description: Requires or disallows whitespace for type definitions.

___no-var-requires.description: Disallows the use of require statements except in import statements.

___interface-over-type-literal.description: Prefer an interface declaration over a type literal (`type T = { ... }`)

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___strict-boolean-expressions.description:
Restricts the types allowed in boolean expressions. By default only booleans are allowed.

The following nodes are checked:
* Arguments to the `!`, `&&`, and `||` operators
* The condition in a conditional expression (`cond ? x : y`)
* Conditions for `if`, `for`, `while`, and `do-while` statements.

___use-default-type-parameter.description: Warns if an explicitly specified type argument is the default for that type parameter.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-misused-new.description: Warns on apparent attempts to define constructors for interfaces or `new` for classes.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-floating-promises.description: Promises returned by functions must be handled appropriately.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unbound-method.description: Warns when a method is used as outside of a method call.

___no-object-literal-type-assertion.description:
Forbids an object literal to appear in a type assertion expression.
Casting to `any` is still allowed.

___no-inferred-empty-object-type.description: Disallow type inference of {} (empty object type) at function and constructor call sites

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unnecessary-type-assertion.description: Warns if a type assertion does not change the type of an expression.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___interface-name.description: Requires interface names to begin with a capital 'I'

___no-reference-import.description: Don't `<reference types="foo" />` if you import `foo` anyway.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-inferrable-types.description: Disallows explicit type declarations for variables or parameters initialized to a number, string, or boolean.

___no-angle-bracket-type-assertion.description: Requires the use of `as Type` for type assertions instead of `<Type>`.

___unified-signatures.description: Warns for any two overloads that could be unified into one by using a union or an optional/rest parameter.

___no-unnecessary-qualifier.description: Warns when a namespace qualifier (`A.x`) is unnecessary.

___no-parameter-properties.description: Disallows parameter properties in class constructors.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___ban-types.description: Bans specific types from being used. Does not ban the corresponding runtime objects from being used.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-function-over-method.description: Warns for class methods that do not use 'this'.

___number-literal-format.description: Checks that decimal literals should begin with '0.' instead of just '.', and should not end with a trailing '0'.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-consecutive-blank-lines.description: Disallows one or more blank lines in a row.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___switch-final-break.description: Checks whether the final clause of a switch statement ends in `break;`.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___max-file-line-count.description: Requires files to remain under a certain number of lines

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___comment-format.description: Enforces formatting rules for single-line comments.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-conditional-expression.description: Recommends to use a conditional expression instead of assigning to the same thing in each branch of an if statement.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___quotemark.description: Requires single or double quotes for string literals.

___newline-per-chained-call.description: Requires that chained method calls be broken apart onto separate lines.

___no-unsafe-finally.description: Disallows control flow statements, such as `return`, `continue` `break` and `throws` in finally blocks.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___object-literal-key-quotes.description: Enforces consistent object literal property quote style.

___deprecation.description: Warns when deprecated APIs are used.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___indent.description: Enforces indentation with tabs or spaces.

___class-name.description: Enforces PascalCased class and interface names.

___no-duplicate-switch-case.description: Prevents duplicate cases in switch statements.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-implicit-dependencies.description: Disallows importing modules that are not listed as dependency in the project’s package.json.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___trailing-comma.description: Requires or disallows trailing commas in array and object literals, destructuring assignments, function typings, named imports and exports and function parameters.

___no-string-literal.description:
Forbids unnecessary string literal property access.
Allows `obj["prop-erty"]` (can't be a regular property access).
Disallows `obj["property"]` (should be `obj.property`).

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-unnecessary-class.description: Disallows classes that are not strictly necessary.

___no-null-keyword.description: Disallows use of the `null` keyword literal.

___no-construct.description: Disallows access to the constructors of `String`, `Number`, and `Boolean`.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___space-before-function-paren.description: Require or disallow a space before function parenthesis

___use-isnan.description: Enforces use of the `isNaN()` function to check for NaN references instead of a comparison to the `NaN` constant.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___arrow-parens.description: Requires parentheses around the parameters of arrow function definitions.

___no-duplicate-super.description: Warns if 'super()' appears twice in a constructor.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___max-line-length.description: Requires lines to be under a certain max length.

___no-unnecessary-initializer.description: Forbids a 'var'/'let' statement or destructuring initializer to be initialized to 'undefined'.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___one-line.description: Requires the specified tokens to be on the same line as the expression preceding them.

___forin.description: Requires a `for ... in` statement to be filtered with an `if` statement.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___file-header.description: Enforces a certain header comment for all files, matched by a regular expression.

___prefer-method-signature.description: Prefer `foo(): void` over `foo: () => void` in interfaces and types.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___semicolon.description: Enforces consistent semicolon usage at the end of every statement.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___radix.description: Requires the radix parameter to be specified when calling `parseInt`.

___no-for-in-array.description: Disallows iterating over an array with a for-in loop.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___cyclomatic-complexity.description: Enforces a threshold of cyclomatic complexity.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___one-variable-per-declaration.description: Disallows multiple variable definitions in the same declaration statement.

___prefer-for-of.description: Recommends a 'for-of' loop over a standard 'for' loop if the index is only used to access the array being iterated.

___no-unnecessary-callback-wrapper.description:
Replaces `x => f(x)` with just `f`.
To catch more cases, enable `only-arrow-functions` and `arrow-return-shorthand` too.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-void-expression.description: Requires expressions of type `void` to appear in statement position.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-template.description: Prefer a template expression over string literal concatenation.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-trailing-whitespace.description: Disallows trailing whitespace at the end of a line.

___newline-before-return.description: Enforces blank line before return when not the only line in the block.

___binary-expression-operand-order.description:
In a binary expression, a literal should always be on the right-hand side if possible.
For example, prefer 'x + 1' over '1 + x'.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-const.description: Requires that variable declarations use `const` instead of `let` and `var` if possible.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-invalid-this.description: Disallows using the `this` keyword outside of classes.

___switch-default.description: Require a `default` case in all `switch` statements.

___no-reference.description: Disallows `/// <reference path=>` imports (use ES6-style imports instead).

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-magic-numbers.description:
Disallows the use constant number values outside of variable assignments.
When no list of allowed values is specified, -1, 0 and 1 are allowed by default.

___typeof-compare.description: Makes sure result of `typeof` is compared to correct string values

___restrict-plus-operands.description: When adding two variables, operands must both be of type number or of type string.

___object-literal-shorthand.description: Enforces use of ES6 object literal shorthand when possible.

___no-duplicate-imports.description: Disallows multiple import statements from the same module.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___space-within-parens.description: Enforces spaces within parentheses or disallow them.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___ban.description: Bans the use of specific functions or global methods.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___arrow-return-shorthand.description: Suggests to convert `() => { return x; }` to `() => x`.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___completed-docs.description: Enforces documentation for important items be filled out.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-default-export.description: Disallows default exports in ES6-style modules.

___label-position.description: Only allows labels in sensible locations.

___promise-function-async.description: Requires any function or method that returns a promise to be marked async.

___no-use-before-declare.description: Disallows usage of variables before their declaration.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___max-classes-per-file.description: A file may not contain more than the specified number of classes

___return-undefined.description: Prefer `return;` in void functions and `return undefined;` in value-returning functions.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-object-spread.description: Enforces the use of the ES2015 object spread operator over `Object.assign()` where appropriate.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___ordered-imports.description: Requires that import statements be alphabetized.

___no-sparse-arrays.description: Forbids array literals to contain missing elements.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___import-spacing.description: Ensures proper spacing between import statement keywords

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___variable-name.description: Checks variable names for various errors.

___eofline.description: Ensures the file ends with a newline.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___triple-equals.description: Requires `===` and `!==` in place of `==` and `!=`.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___jsdoc-format.description: Enforces basic format rules for JSDoc comments.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___object-literal-sort-keys.description: Checks ordering of keys in object literals.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-duplicate-variable.description: Disallows duplicate variable declarations in the same block scope.

___no-irregular-whitespace.description: Disallow irregular whitespace outside of strings and comments

___no-string-throw.description: Flags throwing plain strings or concatenations of strings because only Errors produce proper stack traces.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___import-blacklist.description:
Disallows importing the specified modules directly via `import` and `require`.
Instead only sub modules may be imported from that module.

___no-invalid-template-strings.description: Warns on use of `${` in non-template strings.

___new-parens.description: Requires parentheses when invoking a constructor via the `new` keyword.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___prefer-switch.description: Prefer a `switch` statement to an `if` statement with simple `===` comparisons.

___no-dynamic-delete.description: Bans usage of the delete operator with computed key expressions.

___options.description: An option value or an array of multiple option values.
An option value or an array of multiple option values.

___no-console.description: Bans the use of specified `console` methods.

___no-conditional-assignment.description: Disallows any type of assignment in conditionals.

___rules.description: A map of rules that will be used to lint TypeScript files. These rules apply to `.ts` and `.tsx` files.

___extends.description: The name of a built-in configuration preset, or a path or array of paths to other configuration files which are extended by this configuration. These values are handled using node module resolution semantics.

___rulesDirectory.description: A path to a directory or an array of paths to directories of custom rules. These values are handled using node module resolution semantics, if an `index.js` is placed in your rules directory.

___defaultSeverity.description: The severity level used when a rule specifies "default" as its severity level. If undefined, "error" is used.

___prefer-function-over-method.description: Warns for class methods that do not use 'this'.

___number-literal-format.description: Checks that decimal literals should begin with '0.' instead of just '.', and should not end with a trailing '0'.
